Sentencas: Solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) are considered to be among the most important fuel cells.
Titulo: Constrained model predictive control of a solid oxide fuel cell based on genetic optimization

Sentencas: However, SOFCs present a challenging control problem owing to their slow dynamics, nonlinearity, and tight operating constraints.
Titulo: Constrained model predictive control of a solid oxide fuel cell based on genetic optimization

Sentencas: In this paper, we propose a model predictive control (MPC) strategy based on genetic optimization to solve the SOFC control problem.
Titulo: Constrained model predictive control of a solid oxide fuel cell based on genetic optimization

Sentencas: First, a support vector machine (SVM) model is identified to approximate the behavior of the SOFC system, then a specially designed genetic algorithm (GA) is employed to solve the resulting constrained nonlinear predictive control problem.
Titulo: Constrained model predictive control of a solid oxide fuel cell based on genetic optimization

Sentencas: A terminal cost is incorporated into the standard performance index to further enhance the control performance.
Titulo: Constrained model predictive control of a solid oxide fuel cell based on genetic optimization

Sentencas: Moreover, the GA is accelerated by improving the initial population based on the optimal control sequence obtained for the previous sampling period and a local controller.
Titulo: Constrained model predictive control of a solid oxide fuel cell based on genetic optimization

Sentencas: In addition, a dynamic constraint is also adopted in order to meet the requirements for the desired fuel utilization and control constraints.
Titulo: Constrained model predictive control of a solid oxide fuel cell based on genetic optimization

Sentencas: The measures to achieve offset-free properties are also discussed.
Titulo: Constrained model predictive control of a solid oxide fuel cell based on genetic optimization

Sentencas: Simulation results on an SOFC system illustrate that the proposed method can successfully deal with the control and control move constraints, and that a satisfactory closed-loop performance can be achieved.
Titulo: Constrained model predictive control of a solid oxide fuel cell based on genetic optimization
